translated_text:
Russia does not have a sufficient contingent in Belarus to attack Kyiv, - Reznikov
February 21, 2022,
12:58 p.m
Read the news in Russian
Minister of Defense of Ukraine Oleksiy Reznikov / Ukrainian truth
The Minister of Defense of Ukraine believes that there will be no attack on Kyiv by Belarus. Oleksiy Reznikov emphasized that Russia does not have such a contingent on Belarusian territory that would allow this to be done.
Reznikov announced this during a briefing in Kyiv, Channel 24 informs. He emphasized that he does not believe in the possibility of capturing the capital of Ukraine.
To the topic
For a possible invasion: Reznikov on Ukraine's reaction to the legitimization of the so-called "republics"
The main task of Russia is to threaten and frighten
The head of the Ministry of Defense noted that, according to Ukraine, Belarus has 9,000 representatives of the Russian armed forces, as well as equipment, including missile weapons.
But I want to say that to such a contingent, as someone tells that there will be an attack on Kyiv from the Belarusian side - forgive me, it sounds funny. But threatening us, scaring us, creating a situation of an alleged environment - yes, it works,
Reznikov said.
Reznikov noted that on February 20 he wrote to the Minister of Defense of Belarus Viktor Hryenin. The Ukrainian government official says that he asked for a telephone conversation to ask why the so-called "training" is continuing.
Pay attention!
Reznikov emphasized that the continuation of joint exercises between Russia and Belarus was not a surprise. Part of the military was "withdrawn" from distant districts, so it was not expected that they would be withdrawn early.

Joint training of Russia and Belarus
"Union determination-2022"
were supposed to end on February 20.
However, Putin and Lukashenko announced the continuation of the measures. Like, because of the situation in Donbas.

military exercises will supposedly now be dedicated to the "defense" of Russia and Belarus.
Secretary General of NATO

translated_title: In Kharkiv Oblast, preparations were made to receive residents of ORDLO Den newspaper
translated_text:
February 21, 2022 - 16:27
Tweet
Reuters photo
Kharkiv Oblast is ready to accept residents of the temporarily occupied territories of Donetsk and Luhansk Oblasts if necessary.
Oleg Sinegubov, the head of the Kharkiv Regional State Administration, reported this in Telegram, reports
Ukrinform
.
"A number of meetings were held regarding the possibility of receiving residents of the temporarily occupied territories of Donetsk and Luhansk regions in Kharkiv Oblast in connection with provocations from the aggressor country. The corresponding plans were agreed upon, updated, and consultations were held with the city authorities. We are ready to receive our people, if necessary," the message reads.
According to Synegubov, all specialized security services and relevant structures are mobilized and ready for any challenges.
Earlier, the leaders of the so-called L/DNR announced the evacuation of residents of the occupied territories to the Rostov region of the Russian Federation due to an alleged offensive of the armed forces. On February 20, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Oleksiy Reznikov, reported that the information of the occupiers about the alleged mass evacuation from ORDLO is not true, and that the people who were demonstratively taken to the Russian Federation are returning home on their own.
At the same time, Ukrainian intelligence warns that the propagandists of the Russian occupation forces are preparing another provocation with the shelling of populated areas in the temporarily occupied territory of the Donetsk region. Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces Valery Zaluzhny addressed the residents of the occupied regions of Donetsk and Luhansk regions, emphasizing that Ukraine is not conducting any offensive operations in the east of Ukraine, and urged not to believe the lies of the occupiers.

translated_title: Putin was in his "bunker", and now he started blackmailing the whole world, a military expert - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
Putin was in his "bunker", and now he started blackmailing the whole world, - a military expert
February 21, 2022,
16:10
Read the news in Russian
Putin spent a long time in isolation / Getty Images
For a long time, the Russian president made absolutely no foreign trips, did not participate in any events with foreign delegations and guests. Everything is explained simply - Vladimir Putin was not invited anywhere.
What does the head of the Kremlin want from Ukraine and whether he can officially recognize the temporarily occupied territories of Donbas - military and political commentator Oleksandr Kovalenko said in a comment on the Channel 24 website.
By topic
"Russia is like a monkey with nuclear weapons": why does the Kremlin officially supply weapons to Donbas
The Kremlin is trying to "bargain" for concessions
The expert explained that by declaring the "recognition" of the occupied territories of Donbas, the Kremlin is trying to "bargain" for more significant concessions from the West in response to its own.
In Kovalenko's opinion, consideration of the resolution of the project will not have a significant result. After all, it is "catastrophically unprofitable for Russia to make such a decision." Especially now, when Moscow is directing all its resources to escalation near Ukraine's borders, both land and sea.
The problem is that the escalation created by the Kremlin allows it to conduct a dialogue in the form of blackmail, pressure, but with all that it calls the West to a conversation. Please note that there was a period when representatives of Western countries did not communicate with Putin at all for almost a year,
- remarked Kovalenko.
The expert emphasized that no one "has talked to Putin" for a long time / Photo by Getty Images
It is important
There are almost no signs of de-escalation - Stoltenberg on the situation around Ukraine
Putin "sat in a bunker"
The specialist reminded that
Putin was in his "bunker"
, that is, he was isolated from foreign trips. And it dragged on for over a year. Such abstraction from the outside world was diluted by the meeting of the Russian leader in Geneva with Joe Biden.
The meeting with Biden helped Putin to look outside the world / Photo by Getty Images
The latest news about the threat from Russia:
Putin called an extraordinary meeting of the Security Council
of Russia on February 21. The topic is not mentioned, but experts believe that the head of the Kremlin can officially "legitimize" the pro-Russian militants in Donbas.
The Speaker of the Parliament, Ruslan Stefanchuk, said that the Verkhovna Rada is considering various scenarios for the development of Russian aggression. In particular, if necessary
martial law may be imposed in Ukraine
, but this is not currently the case.
National Police of Ukraine until February 26
will carry out the service in an enhanced mode.
Currently, more than 2,000 police officers guard 245 critical infrastructure facilities.
Importantly!
The armed forces of Ukraine are ready to repel the enemy at any moment, therefore we are under the reliable protection of our military. International partners support Ukraine and have prepared a package of devastating economic sanctions against Russia. Therefore, even if the Kremlin dares to go on the offensive, it will receive a worthy rebuff. Let's keep calm, read verified news and believe in the Armed Forces!

100% probability - a Russian deputy about the introduction of troops into the occupied Donbas
February 21, 2022,
23:15
Read the news in Russian
Russian MP Kalashnikov said that the Kremlin will send troops into occupied Donbas / Getty Images
Russia has announced that it will deploy its troops to the temporarily occupied Donbas. Before that, Vladimir Putin officially "legitimized" the fake republics.
This opinion was expressed by the Russian deputy Vyacheslav Kalashnikov and was quoted by rosZMI. He believes that the Kremlin "will 100% introduce troops."
To the topic
A repeat of the 2008 scenario, Georgia condemned the recognition of militants
According to the Russian parliamentarian, this will happen after the signing of an aid agreement between the Kremlin and its puppets in Donbas.
Putin can send in troops already at night
The Pentagon said that after recognizing the quasi-republics, Vladimir Putin can send his troops to Donbas.
This can happen already at night against February 22.
What preceded it
On February 21, the head of the Kremlin officially recognized the fake republics in the occupied Donbas. In addition, he began to openly threaten Ukraine and cynically called for an "immediate cessation of hostilities." Although it is Russia that is shelling the populated areas and infrastructure of Donbass.
In Ukraine, due to the recognition of quasi-republics, criminal cases were opened under the article on calls to change the borders of the state territory. After Putin's cynical decree, the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine gathered for an urgent meeting.

They don't hang around, - Feigin about Russia's cynical distribution of fakes according to the method
February 21, 2022,
16:37
Read the news in Russian
Russia still depends on the authenticity of its fakes / Getty Images
Russian propaganda produces false videos of shelling. However, the aggressor state itself no longer believes in its fakes.
The world has long understood about Russia's fakes. A Russian human rights defender told about this on Channel 24
Mark Fagin
.
Pay attention
New fake: Russians say they destroyed 5 "Ukrainian saboteurs" and ask for reinforcements
Feigin: Russia is following the methodology
According to him, earlier Russia at least tried to create the appearance of truthfulness of its propaganda. However, they don't even worry about it now.
There has been some change. According to Telegram channels, they (Russians - Channel 24) are not worried about this (spreading fakes - Channel 24) at all. Russia is simply carrying out, it seems, some kind of technique, realizing that no one will believe it.
Mark Fagin
Russian human rights defender
Ukraine and the world worked ahead of time
He believes that there is no point in hoping that Russia will invent some more or less true information. "Not only the Ukrainian mass media and the Ukrainian government, but also the Western media worked to get ahead of us," the Russian human rights defender noted.
Importantly!
The Armed Forces of Ukraine are ready to repel the enemy at any moment, because we are under the reliable protection of our military. International partners support Ukraine and have prepared a package of devastating economic sanctions against Russia. Therefore, even if the Kremlin dares to go on the offensive, it will receive a worthy rebuff.
Let's keep calm, read verified news and believe in the Armed Forces!
Russia continues to spread cynical fakes
The Kremlin does not stop staging provocations in Donbas and blames the attacks on the Ukrainian army. The Federal Security Service said that our Armed Forces allegedly
fired upon the border outfits
in the Rostov region. U
State Border Service
of Ukraine denied the relevant information.
The occupying power wants
provoke the Ukrainian army to respond
, to then show how our Armed Forces are allegedly advancing.
At the same time, it was announced in the temporarily occupied Donetsk and Luhansk regions
forced mobilization
all men, even those who are unfit for service for various reasons. Militants forcefully mobilize minors, the sick, the elderly, as well as persons with a criminal past. All residents receive a message urging them to come to the "commissariats", otherwise "criminal liability" awaits them.
The occupiers also placed billboards like
Russian propaganda
- with references to the victory in the Second World War. However, many men in the self-proclaimed republics do not want to go to war.

translated_title: Lukashenko threatens war. What Ukraine can expect from Belarus ‚Äî High Castle
translated_text:
From the meeting of the leaders of Russia and Belarus, which took place in the Kremlin on February 18, they were waiting for statements that could pave the way for the de-escalation of the conflict
After all, it is no secret that the very conduct of Russian exercises in Belarus raises suspicions of readiness for an attack on the Ukrainian capital.
But no encouraging statements were made at the press conference of Vladimir Putin and Alexander Lukashenko. On the contrary, the Belarusian ruler competed in aggressiveness with his Russian counterpart, writes Vitaly Portnikov for
Radio Freedom.
And even this short meeting with journalists allows you to see what changes have taken place with Lukashenko since 2020.
Oleksandr Lukashenko
was always an authoritarian leader and did not hide his nostalgia for the Soviet era. The thing that
Belarus
under his rule turned into a preserve of the past - in many ways a reflection of his worldview. And yet, despite all the rhetoric of integration, the union state and hugs with Russian presidents, Lukashenko has never forgotten that he is the head of an independent state.
The massacre of opposition activists and the creation of an authoritarian state closed the door to him at the residence of Western leaders. But in the post-Soviet space, the Belarusian president tried to look like a politician who maintains good relations with everyone:
After Russia's war against Georgia, he maintained not only diplomatic relations with this country, but also personal contacts with President Mikheil Saakashvili.
After the victory of the Maidan in 2013-2014 in Ukraine, when Russian propaganda was talking about the "junta", he met with the head of the Verkhovna Rada and acting president of the country Oleksandr Turchynov.
Lukashenko still has not recognized the "independence" of Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
He did not visit Crimea after its occupation by Russia.
After Minsk became the center of negotiations on the settlement of the conflict in Donbas, it tried to use the situation to return to contacts with Western leaders.
2020 changed everything
Lukashenko was convinced that he had lost the popular support that allowed him to "freeze" the development of Belarus. And that only the support of Russia and the actions of the Belarusian security forces helped him maintain power. But bayonets are a poor support for any mode. Without Putin's political and economic help, Lukashenka simply cannot stand.
And Lukashenko is trying to prove his usefulness to those on whom his political survival depends. The position of "friendship with everyone" gave way to the position of unconditional support for any Russian initiatives and statements.
Lukashenko insults Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyi in Putin's presence. Threatens Ukraine with war. Hints that Russian troops can stay in Belarus for as long as they want - even after his own Foreign Minister Volodymyr Makei spoke about their withdrawal from the territory of Belarus. That is, it supports the very tension that Vladimir Putin so needs. From the leader of the country, who talked about losses in the Second World War and claimed to support peace in Belarus and its non-intervention in conflicts, Lukashenko has become a ruler who is provoking a possible war near his own borders.

US President Joseph Biden has previously agreed to a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in the coming days, provided the Russian Federation does not invade Ukraine. About this
it is said
in a statement issued by White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki on February 20.
Joe Biden agreed to meet with Vladimir Putin following talks on February 24 between US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, "

This is the format of negotiations

Note that after the conversation with Putin, Macron spoke with Volodymyr Zelensky. During this conversation, the presidents supported the necessity of convening a tripartite contact group and the immediate introduction of a regime of silence in Donbas.

Against the background of the massing of troops along the Ukrainian borders, Russian fighters have been massed for the fourth day

evacuation

translated_text:
Zelensky urgently appealed to Ukrainians
February 22, 2022,
01:59
Read the news in Russian
Zelensky urgently appealed to Ukrainians / Office of the President
Against the background of the threat of a Russian invasion, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi made an urgent appeal to Ukrainians on February 21.
Zelensky recorded the address after the meeting of the National Security and Defense Council.
It is important
Zelensky held urgent consultations with Scholz and Macron
"We and our country do not have time for long lectures on history. So I will not talk about the past. I will talk about the realities and the future. Behind me is Ukraine in its internationally recognized borders. And they will remain so. Despite everything, despite any statements of Russia," the politician said. He thanked the citizens for keeping calm and self-confidence.
You once again prove that Ukrainians are a smart and wise nation. And despite everything, he keeps a cool head, reacts calmly, calmly, in an adult manner,
- added Zelensky.
The president emphasized that there are no reasons for a sleepless night. Like, if they appear, the citizens will be informed about it immediately and nothing will be hidden from them.
Zelensky addressed Ukrainians: watch the video
What preceded it
The last few days have recorded a serious escalation in Donbas. Militants break all agreements, opening fire dozens of times. On February 21, as a result of the shelling of Zaitsevo
two soldiers were killed
, three others were wounded. In addition, the occupiers are also digging into the civilian infrastructure. They fired at Shchastya and Vrubivka. Thousands of people were left without electricity, water and gas.
Russian President Vladimir Putin convened a meeting of the Security Council of Russia on February 21, at which he discussed the "legitimization" of militants. There were even statements about the "joining of Donbass".

translated_title: The G7 countries called on Russia to influence the terrorist organizations "LPR" and "DNR". BUG - bug.org.ua
translated_text:
The G7 countries called on Russia to influence the terrorist organizations "LPR" and "DNR"
03:26 | 21.02.2022 /
News
/
war in the east
,
Donbas
,
Russia
/
Views
0
/
There are no comments
Russia can use "staged incidents" in Donbas as a pretext for further invasion of Ukraine. Moscow must influence the "LPR" and "DPR"
for de-escalation.
This is stated in the joint statement of the ministers of foreign affairs of the G7 countries following the meeting in Munich, reports
Correspondent
.
"Russia should use its influence over the self-proclaimed 'republics' for the purpose of restraint and de-escalation," the document says.
G7 representatives noted that the increase in the number of ceasefire violations along the contact line in Donbas in recent days is a cause of serious concern.
"We condemn the use of heavy weapons and indiscriminate shelling of peaceful areas, which are an obvious violation of the Minsk agreements. We also condemn the fact that the Russian Federation continues to distribute Russian passports to residents of non-government-controlled regions of Ukraine. This clearly contradicts the spirit of the Minsk agreements," the statement emphasizes.
The G7 strongly supports the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, whose observers play a key role in de-escalation efforts. This mission should be allowed to fulfill its mandate in the East of Ukraine in full without restrictions on its activities and freedom of movement, the G7 noted.
The G7 countries also expect Russia to reduce its military presence near Ukraine's borders and state that they have not yet seen any evidence of this.
"We will judge Russia by its actions," the heads of foreign policy departments noted.
The G7 representatives also confirmed their commitment to a peaceful and diplomatic solution to the current crisis. Moscow was urged to start consultations within the framework of the US-Russia dialogue on strategic stability, the Russia-NATO Council and the OSCE.
In addition, the heads of foreign affairs of the G7 highly appreciated the OSCE dialogue on European security and expressed the firm hope that "Russia will take a constructive part in it."
On February 18, the leaders of the "L/DNR" militants announced the mass evacuation of residents of the occupied territories to Russia due to the alleged threat of an offensive by the Ukrainian military. However, the Ukrainian army and the National Security Council assured that Ukraine is not planning any attack on the occupied Donbas, and the local population is being misled.
How
reported
Operational-tactical group "East" On February 19, militants of the "Private Military Company of Wagner" arrived in Donetsk. According to intelligence data, the "Wagneri people" are to carry out several terrorist attacks in the city - to blow up residential buildings.

translated_title: The Ministry of Health has named which regions remain in the red zone - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
The Ministry of Health named the regions that remain in the red zone
February 21, 2022,
13:16
Read the news in Russian
The Ministry of Health has updated the quarantine zones / Unsplash
As of February 21, four regions are in the yellow zone of epidemic danger, and 5 regions are in the red zone.
Source:
Ministry of Health
Yellow zone
So, Lviv, Poltava, Kharkiv and Chernivtsi regions are in the yellow quarantine zone.
Attention
A new decline over the weekend: more than 13,500 patients with COVID-19 were detected in a day
Red zone
Zakarpattia, Ivano-Frankivsk, Luhansk, Rivne and Khmelnytsky regions are at the red level of epidemic safety.
The rest of the regions, in particular, Kyiv, are in the orange quarantine zone.
Morbidity indicators
As of February 21, the incidence rate in the country is 1,121 per 100,000 population, with a defined indicator of 75 per 100,000 people. In Kyiv, this indicator is 1,687 per 100,000 people.
The level of hospitalizations in the country is 53.6, with a defined rate of 60 per 100,000 population. In Kyiv, the level of hospitalizations is 47.7.
The indicator of occupancy of oxygen beds was not exceeded in any region of Ukraine.
Current quarantine zoning of the country / Infographics of the Ministry of Health
Weekly statistics have positive dynamics
The need for hospitalization decreases
In Ukraine, the number of hospitalizations is decreasing for the second week in a row. So, over the past week, 20,402 patients were hospitalized, which is 4,000 less than the previous week. The Minister of Health Viktor Lyashko announced the data during a briefing on February 21.
He also informed that
last week was the first in the last 6 when the number of patients discharged from hospitals exceeded the number of hospitalizations
. In particular, 4,000 more people were discharged from hospitals than were hospitalized.
Pay attention!
The weekly number of hospitalizations with coronavirus is decreasing in 21 out of 25 regions of Ukraine. In the remaining 4 regions - in Dnipropetrovsk, Zaporizhzhya, Kirovohrad, Cherkasy - the situation remains under control.
The workload of hospitals at the moment
As of February 21, there are 24,716 patients with COVID-19 in health care facilities. Occupancy of beds with oxygen during the week also decreased by 5.4% and is 35%.
The occupancy of children's beds also remains under control. Their occupancy remains at 31%, which is 8.9% less compared to the previous week.

translated_title: Putin signed a friendship agreement with the leaders of the militants - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
Putin signed a friendship treaty with the leaders of the militants
February 21, 2022,
21:41
Read the news in Russian
Putin signed contracts with militant leaders / Getty Images
On the evening of February 21, the head of the Kremlin recognized the pseudo-republic of militants in Donbas. Immediately after that, he signed contracts with the leaders of his mercenaries.
First, the head of the Kremlin signed orders on the recognition of pseudo-republics in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine. Subsequently, together with militants Denis Pushylin and Leonid Pasichnyk, he signed a contract. The signing ceremony was broadcast by federal channels.
It is important
Putin announced the "recognition" of the independence of the Donbas militants
Russia signed an agreement on cooperation with militants
After more than half an hour's address, Putin announced the recognition of the "independence" of the militant pseudo-republics. Immediately after that, a document signing ceremony took place in the Kremlin.
Therefore, Russia signed an agreement on "friendship, cooperation and assistance" with the leaders of the militants.
Putin signs decrees on the recognition of militants and treaties of friendship with them
Pay attention!
Having recognized the militants, Russia actually withdrew from the Minsk agreements. Ukrainian and world politicians warned about this. Earlier, Peskov also confirmed this awareness.
Putin recognized the militants: the main thing
Back in January 2022, the Russian communists announced that they had prepared an appeal to the head of the Kremlin with a request to recognize the militants in the pseudo-republics on the temporarily occupied territory of Ukraine.
On February 15, the State Duma supported this appeal, and it actually ended up on the table of the head of the Kremlin.
Western leaders warned Putin against recognizing the militants. The head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said that sanctions would be imposed on Russia after such a step.

"In connection with the difficult epidemiological situation, as well as the temporary optimization of the staff of the Consulate General of the Russian Federation, which was made by analogy with the actions of a number of Western countries, the appointment has been suspended. The issuance of ready documents will be carried out in accordance with the current schedule," the message says.

The consulate also reminded that March 8 is a day off at the diplomatic mission.

a number of countries
against the background of fears of a full-scale invasion by Russian troops, they urged their citizens to leave Ukraine urgently.

in Ukraine, who remained to work, moved to Lviv. Greece also announced the reduction of its embassy in Kyiv to a minimum. At the same time, the country will strengthen the staff of the Consulate General in Mariupol. The British Embassy is being temporarily moved from Kyiv to Lviv due to fears of a new Russian aggression against Ukraine.

moves to Lviv. At the same time, diplomats will remain in Kyiv, whose presence is necessary to perform the main functions of the diplomatic mission

Ukraine convenes the UN Security Council due to Russia's recognition of the "LDNR".

Ivan Music

Twitter
LB.ua in Google News

Ukraine demands to convene a meeting
UN Security Council
due to Russia's decision to recognize the occupied territories of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions as independent "republics".
This was announced by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine
Dmytro Kuleba
.
"Ukraine demands to convene a meeting of the UN Security Council in connection with the illegal actions of the Russian Federation. The corresponding request has already been submitted to the Security Council," Kuleba wrote on Twitter.
Ukraine demands to convene a meeting of the UN Security Council in connection with the illegal actions of the Russian Federation. The relevant appeal has already been submitted to the Security Council.
‚Äî Dmytro Kuleba (@DmytroKuleba)

Vladimir Putin
announced the recognition of "independence"
illegitimate formations "DPR" and "LPR", which are temporarily occupied parts of Donetsk and Luhansk regions. He asked the Federal Assembly to ratify it.
Putin also ordered the introduction of Russian troops into the occupied regions of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

translated_title: Turkey strongly recommended its citizens to leave Eastern Ukraine - Channel 24
translated_text:
Turkey strongly advised its citizens to leave Eastern Ukraine
February 21, 2022,
23:46
Read the news in Russian
Turkey issued recommendations for its citizens / Unsplash
On Monday, February 21, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkey strongly recommended its citizens to leave Eastern Ukraine. This happened within hours after Russia recognized the militants in Donbas.
Source:
Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkey
Citizens of Turkey are asked to contact the country's embassy in Kyiv if necessary. At the same time, there is currently no talk of a call to leave Ukraine at all.
Note
Ukraine can ask Turkey to close the channels to Russia in the Black Sea
In light of recent events, we strongly urge our citizens to leave the eastern regions of Ukraine,
- the message says.
Putin instructed to send troops to the occupied Donbass
Vladimir Putin is cynical
recognized the militants in the occupied Donbas
. Such a decision has already caused sharp condemnation in NATO and the countries of the West.
In particular, Joe Biden, Emmanuel Macron and Olaf Scholz have said that this is the decision
is "a clear violation of the Minsk agreements"
. Boris Johnson emphasized: Russia's actions
is a violation of international law
.
Meanwhile, Putin instructed the Russian armed forces to ensure "peace" in the occupied Donbas. In fact, this means that the aggressor country
is going to introduce its troops into the occupied Ukrainian territories
.
Note!
The Pentagon said that Putin can give an order to send the troops of the aggressor country to the occupied territories of Donbas already
on the night of Tuesday, February 22
.

translated_title: They are trying to implement this scenario - the Ministry of Defense announced the Kremlin's aggression plan - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
They are trying to implement this scenario - the Ministry of Defense announced the Kremlin's plan of aggression
February 21, 2022,
12:52 p.m
Read the news in Russian
Reznikov voiced a possible scenario of Russian aggression / ArmiyaInform
The Minister of Defense of Ukraine once again commented on the possible new aggression of the Kremlin. Oleksiy Reznikov even disclosed the alleged plan of the Russian invasion.
During his briefing, the minister stated that the threat level remains high, Channel 24 informs. However, the authorities are predicting possible scenarios in order to choose tactics in the event of a possible offensive.
To the topic
Under the guise of exercises: Russia has introduced amphibious and combat ships to the Sea of Azov
What exactly can Russia plan
According to Reznikov, the Ministry of Defense considered the scenario that Russia would try to literally surround Ukraine with troops - from the Belarusian Brest to the Russian Taganrog, on land, on 2 seas and in the temporarily occupied Crimea.
Note!
Oleksiy Reznikov said that he does not see the withdrawal and reduction of the number of Russian troops. However, he assured that all parts of Ukraine
in combat readiness
.
"(The Russians - Channel 24) noted the activity in the temporarily occupied part of Moldova - in Transnistria. It was also expected that against this background, Russia would arrange an escalation in the East of Ukraine," he noted.
Other methods of pressure
In particular, the head of the Ministry of Defense explained that the occupiers will accompany the aggression with other means of pressure:
cyber attacks;
mining;
unrest.
The purpose of the actions is to shake Ukraine from the inside, so that we change our political course and abandon the EU and NATO, and eventually lose our independence. Currently, they are trying to implement this scenario,
- emphasized the minister.
Reznikov's latest statements: the main thing
The Minister of Defense noted. that since the beginning of the escalation in Donbas on February 17, the occupiers damaged 4 educational institutions and 5 objects of civil infrastructure. Reznikov fighters themselves
called "monkeys with grenades"
.
How
said the head of the Ministry of Defense
, if Russia recognizes the "formation" of militants in Donbas, then after that the invasion can take place by "introducing so-called peacekeepers".
Reznikov also spoke about the forced "evacuation" of Donbas residents. He called it a "farce", because several thousand people
was taken out for demonstration
, although then they return home themselves.

translated_title: A Cossack at the Red Security asked Putin whether it is time to annex Donbas - Channel 24
translated_text:
A Cossack at the Security Council asked Putin whether it was time to annex Donbass
February 21, 2022,
16:34
Read the news in Russian
Dmytro Kozak slandered the "joining of Donbass" / TASS
A meeting of the Security Council is being held in Russia to discuss the issue of Donbas. After the report, Dmytro Kozak wanted to express his opinion on whether it is time to "join Donbas".
The deputy head of the administration of the President of Russia and the representative of Moscow in "Normandy" spoke after the head of the Foreign Ministry Sergey Lavrov, Channel 24 informs. Within a few minutes, he proved that "Kyiv is not capable of fulfilling the Minsk agreements."
To the topic
The militants officially asked Putin for recognition
Kozak wanted to speak about the "accession of Donbass"
Although the Security Council was supposed to consider only the issue of recognition of the so-called "republics" of militants, Kozak ended his speech in a sensational way - he asked
does Putin want to know his opinion on the "accession of Donbass".
Volodymyr Volodymyrovych, is it here or later? I just wanted to answer the question about whether or not to annex Donbas? What to do next? How to use it in negotiations with the West? Because this is such a serious problem,
- asked Kozak.
"Hmm‚Ä¶ So what?" Putin asked in response. Then a voice rang out from the hall and the Russian president decided to stop Kozak, noting that he should limit himself to just speaking. "Then and then," agreed the representative of Russia.
Read also
RosZMI writes that the TCG will not meet before March
Militants asked to recognize Putin as a "quasi-republic":
Back on February 15, the State Duma of Russia sent an appeal to Putin regarding the recognition of "pseudo-republics" in Donbas.
This decision was sharply criticized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine,
EU and NATO.
February 21 with such
the leaders of the militants also made an appeal
Denys Pushylin and Leonid Pasichnyk.
They ask not only for recognition, but also for "help in defense".

translated_title: In Russia, it was explained in which borders the occupied lands of Donbas were recognized by the occupiers - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
In Russia, it was explained in what borders the lands of Donbas captured by the occupiers were recognized
February 21, 2022,
22:27
Read the news in Russian
Russia explained in which borders it recognized the occupiers / Valentina Polishchuk, Channel 24
On February 21, Vladimir Putin officially recognized the militants in the occupied Donbas. Russia has already ventured into cynical explanations.
In particular, the Kremlin said which borders "recognized" the occupiers. They say that they allegedly did it within the borders that are actually established now. The words of Putin's henchmen are quoted by rosZMI.
Read also
From 4 minutes - Putin fantasized how long it would take NATO missiles from Ukraine to reach Moscow
They are going to consider friendship with the occupiers
In addition to "recognition", Putin also wants to officially "make friends" with the militants.
Andriy Klimov, the deputy head of the Russian International Affairs Committee, said that on February 22, the Federation Council will ratify "agreements on friendship and cooperation" with mercenaries in the occupied Donbas.
The West condemns Putin's actions
The partners stand in solidarity with Ukraine and are beginning to express their support to our country against the backdrop of Putin's decision. Italy, Denmark, and Lithuania have already announced this.
Poland
convenes the European Council
and insists on sanctions against Russia.
NATO also supports us. And President Zelenskyy already
discussed the situation
with Joe Biden and Boris Johnson.

translated_title: Poland convenes the European Council and calls for sanctions against Russia due to the recognition of militants - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
Poland convenes the European Council and calls for sanctions against Russia for recognizing militants
February 21, 2022,
22:08
Read the news in Russian
Moravetsky reacted to the recognition of the militants / AFP
Poland has already reacted to the decision of the head of the Kremlin to recognize militants in the pseudo-republics in Donbas. Because of this, the Prime Minister of the country, Mateusz Moravetskyi, convenes the European Council.
Source:
twitter of Mateusz Moravetskyi
According to Moravetsky, the actions of the Kremlin are a gross violation of international law. Therefore, Europe should react accordingly.
Note
Self-proclaimed South Ossetia and Abkhazia supported the legitimization of militant "republics"
Moravetsky calls for sanctions
The head of the Polish government emphasized that the actions of the Kremlin are aggression against Ukraine. In addition, in this way the Kremlin demonstrates its reluctance to continue diplomatic dialogue.
This is an act of aggression against Ukraine, which must be answered unambiguously in the form of immediate sanctions,
Moravetsky emphasized.
According to Moravetskyi, sanctions are the only language that Putin understands. Regarding the introduction of sanctions, the head of the Polish government convened the European Council.
The European Council reacted to the recognition of militants
Head of the European Council
Charles Michel
reacted to the Kremlin's decision. He called these actions a gross violation of international law and the Minsk agreements. According to him, the EU will certainly react to the Kremlin's action.
The EU and its partners will respond with unity, firmness and determination,
- emphasized Michel.
Pay attention!
Having recognized the militants, Russia actually withdrew from the Minsk agreements. Ukrainian and world politicians warned about this. Earlier, Peskov also confirmed this awareness.
Putin recognized the militants: the main thing
On February 15, 2022, the State Duma of Russia voted to appeal to Putin to recognize the pseudo-republic of militants in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine.
On February 21, after a meeting of the Security Council, Putin announced the recognition of pseudo-republics. After that, he signed the relevant documents and a friendship agreement with the leaders of the militants.
Following Russia, he expressed "support" for mercenaries in Donbas
Syrian leader Bashar Assad
and leaders of others
unrecognized republics
South Ossetia and Abkhazia.

translated_title: Why does Putin have a smokescreen of "invasion" of Ukraine - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
The author
Boris Akunin
The writer
Why does Putin have a smokescreen of "invasion" of Ukraine
February 21, 2022,
14:38
Read the news in Russian
Vladimir Putin will not decide on a full-scale invasion of Ukraine / Getty Images
I am sure that there will be no invasion of Ukraine and all this rattling of iron is nothing more than a smoke screen to draw back Donbas, which is already occupied.
Source:
Facebook of Boris Akunin
Putin wants to try on sheepskin
The general excitement "ah, this Putin is so scary, he will eat everyone now" is an important component of Putin's plan. Everyone reacts in the expected way - they are horrified.
To the topic
Deceived pawns and staged farce: what is really happening in occupied Luhansk
Putin's menace in the eyes of the world community grows not every day, but every hour. Why this is done is generally clear. If they do not respect - let them be afraid.
In addition, when everyone was "waiting for bloodshed" from you, and you only "ate a chickadee", then, look, it will pass without serious sanctions.
About important things
The Kremlin knows who will lose in this war
The maximum that Putin will go to is another escalation in Donbas / Photo by Getty Images
Live scenery
But what a pity for the unfortunate residents of Donbas, who have to be pawns in this cynical geopolitical game. And for the unfortunate soldiers, someone's children, who are freezing for weeks in damnable conditions, it's also a pity.
Don't forget!
The armed forces of Ukraine are ready to repel the enemy at any moment, because we are under the reliable protection of our military. International partners support Ukraine and have prepared a package of devastating economic sanctions against Russia. Therefore, even if the Kremlin dares to go on the offensive, it will receive a worthy rebuff. Let's keep calm, read verified news and believe in the Armed Forces!

translated_title: In 2021, construction volume of 13 regions increased in Ukraine, - Ministry of Regions Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine
translated_text:
In 2021, construction volume of 13 regions increased in Ukraine, - Ministry of Regions Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine
In English
Main
News
In 2021, the construction volumes of 13 regions in Ukraine increased, the Ministry of Regions said
In 2021, the construction volumes of 13 regions in Ukraine increased, the Ministry of Regions said
Ministry of Development of Communities and Territories of Ukraine
,
published
February 21, 2022
year of
14:13
Construction
0
spread
In 2021, Ukrainian enterprises completed construction works worth almost 254 billion hryvnias. The index of construction products, in comparison with 2020, is more than 105%. Deputy Minister of Community and Territorial Development Nataliya Kozlovska informed about this.
"Throughout 2021, the construction industry of Ukraine maintained a stable growth rate of construction volumes. Therefore, compared to 2020, the index of construction products increased by 105.1%. 3 oblasts - Ternopil, Vinnytsia and Cherkasy - became the leaders in terms of construction growth," noted Nataliya Kozlovska.
In particular, the index of construction products (compared to 2020) in Ternopil Oblast was 137.3%, Vinnytsia Oblast ‚Äì 120.1%, Cherkasy Oblast ‚Äì 117.6%. In general, enterprises in 13 regions increased the volume of construction work in 2021.
The general trend in December 2021, compared to the previous month, was influenced by the growth of construction volumes of non-residential buildings by 79.9% and engineering structures by 96.2%. Therefore, at the end of the year, the construction index of engineering structures was 60.3%, residential buildings - 15.1%, and non-residential buildings - 24.6%.
New construction and reconstruction accounted for 55% of the total volume of production, while major and current repairs accounted for 45%, respectively.
Enterprises from 8 regions of the country (Kyiv, Odesa, Dnipropetrovsk, Kharkiv, Lviv, Kyiv, Vinnytsia and Donetsk regions) completed 76% of the total construction volume.

Russia announced the killing of "five Ukrainian saboteurs" on its territory
2 hours ago
Siverskyi Donets is a natural barrier for a considerable length, which separates the government-controlled part of Luhansk region and the territory controlled by the Russian-backed LPR group
SHARE
Russia announced the killing of "five Ukrainian saboteurs" on its territory
share
See comments
Printing
The Russian military claims that on the morning of February 21, they killed five members of a Ukrainian "sabotage and intelligence group" near the settlement of Mityakinsk in the Rostov region. As the press service of the Southern Military District stated, the "combat clash" took place around 06:00 (this is 05:00 in Kyiv) on the section of the Russian-Ukrainian border
Also, the Russian military points out that two infantry fighting vehicles of the armed forces of Ukraine, which were destroyed by anti-tank weapons, entered the territory of Russia allegedly for the "evacuation of saboteurs".
The settlement of Mityakinska is located on the northern bank of the Siverskyi Donets River, close to the border with Ukraine. On the territory of Ukraine, this river is a natural barrier that separates the government-controlled part of the Luhansk region from the territory controlled by the Russian-backed LPR group.
The Ukrainian side has not yet commented on this statement of the Russian military, but earlier on February 21, it denied the involvement of the Ukrainian military in the destruction of the structure, which in Russia was called a border post, located 150 meters from the border with Ukraine.
Ukraine has repeatedly stated that it does not plan any offensive actions in Donbas and accused Russia of looking for an excuse for escalation.

translated_title: Blinken: Russia's recognition of the "DPR" and "LPR" is a clear attack on the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine
translated_text:
00:25
22.02.2022
Blinken: Russia's recognition of the "DPR" and "LPR" is a clear attack on the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine
2 minutes to read
Russia's recognition of the "Donetsk People's Republic" and the "Luhansk People's Republic" is a clear attack on the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken said.
"We strongly condemn President Putin's decision to recognize the so-called Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics as 'independent'. As we said when the Duma first made the request: this decision is a complete rejection of Russia's obligations under the Minsk agreements, directly contradicts Russia's stated commitment to diplomacy and is a clear attack on the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine," Blinken said in a statement. published on the website of the US State Department on Monday.
He emphasized that states have an obligation not to recognize a new "state" created by the threat of force or its use, as well as an obligation not to violate the borders of another state.
"Russia's decision is another example of President Putin's flagrant disregard for international law and norms," ‚Äã‚Äãthe US Secretary of State believes.
Blinken noted that US President Joe Biden will sign an executive order banning all new investment, trade and financing by US persons in, from or on the territory of the "Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics" of Ukraine.
"We will continue to coordinate with Ukraine and our allies and partners to take appropriate steps in response to this unprovoked and unacceptable action by Russia. This decree is aimed at preventing Russia from benefiting from this flagrant violation of international law. It is not directed against the people of Ukraine or the government of Ukraine and will allow humanitarian and other related activities to continue in these regions," he explained.
Blinken emphasized that the US support for the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, as well as the government and people of Ukraine, is unwavering.
"Together with our Ukrainian partners, we strongly condemn President Putin's statement," Blinken said in a statement.

translated_title: Putin's puppets exploded with statements about the recognition of militants: the Houthis in Yemen and Chechnya were added - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
Putin's puppets exploded with statements about the recognition of militants: the Houthis in Yemen and Chechnya were added
February 21, 2022,
22:50
Read the news in Russian
Kadyrov, as expected, "welcomed Putin's decision" / DW
On the evening of February 21, the head of the Kremlin, Vladimir Putin, announced the "recognition" of the so-called "republics" of the Donetsk and Luhansk militants. While Western countries are reacting harshly, Chechnya and the Houthis in Yemen arrived to welcome Putin and the mercenaries.
This is reported by the Russian mass media with reference to official sources, Channel 24 informs.
It is important
Putin announced the "recognition" of the independence of the Donbas militants
Kadyrov blamed Ukraine for the situation
The head of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, traditionally blamed Ukraine for the situation. Putin, they say, had no other choice.
Hundreds of thousands of Russians live in Donetsk and Luhansk, and Russia has never abandoned its own. They will not be doomed even now. Peoples will finally be able to defend their rights in the international arena,
Kadyrov said.
They also "welcomed the recognition" of the militants and the Houthis in Yemen. These are rebels fighting pro-government forces in the country.
Who else, after Russia, recognized the "independence of militants":
self-proclaimed Abkhazia;
self-proclaimed South Ossetia;
Syria;
Cuba;
Venezuela;
Nicaragua.
Read also
NATO condemned Russia's recognition of militants in Donbas
Pay attention!
Meanwhile
countries of the West one after another
condemn Vladimir Putin's decision and promise to respond with sanctions. The EU and NATO reacted harshly to the events of February 21.

translated_title: Last year, construction works worth almost 254 billion hryvnias were carried out in Ukraine News on Gazeta.ua
translated_text:
Economy
Monday, February 21, 2022
15:13
Economy
In which areas the pace of construction increased the most in 2021
Comment
In 2021, the construction industry of Ukraine grew steadily. Photo: pixabay.com
Last year, construction works worth almost UAH 254 billion were completed in Ukraine.
Deputy Minister of Community and Territorial Development Nataliya Kozlovska informed about this, informs
"Government Portal"
.
"Throughout 2021, the construction industry of Ukraine maintained a stable growth rate of construction volumes.
Compared to 2020, the index of construction products increased by 105.1%. Three oblasts: Ternopil, Vinnytsia, and Cherkasy became the leaders in terms of construction growth rates," Nataliya Kozlovska noted.
In particular, the index of construction products in comparison with 2020 in Ternopil region was 137.3%, in Vinnytsia - 120.1%, Cherkasy - 117.6%. In general, the volume of construction work in 2021 was increased by enterprises in 13 regions.
READ ALSO:
The Americans won the competition for the construction of the first section of the Kyiv district
According to the results of the year, the construction index of engineering structures was 60.3%, residential buildings - 15.1%, and non-residential buildings - 24.6%.
New construction and reconstruction make up 55% of the total volume of production, while major and ongoing repairs make up 45%, respectively.
Enterprises from eight regions of the country (Kyiv, Odesa, Dnipropetrovsk, Kharkiv, Lviv, Kyiv, Vinnytsia, and Donetsk regions) completed 76% of the total construction volume.
In December last year, on average, one construction worker was paid UAH 12,957, which is 10.3% more compared to the previous month and 12.0% more than December 2020.
According to this indicator, construction took 15th place among 16 types of economic activity.
As part of the program "Big construction" this year is planned
build and reconstruct
715 facilities throughout the country.
Among these facilities are 5,500 km of state roads, at least 1,400 km of local roads, 282 educational institutions, 68 medical facilities, 339 sports facilities, more than 6,800 sports grounds in yards.

translated_title: War with Russia: the occupiers damaged more than a hundred houses near the demarcation line in Donbas News on Gazeta.ua
translated_text:
Donbass
Monday, February 21, 2022
06:20
Donbass
Special topic:
The enemy near the Ukrainian border
The occupiers damaged more than a hundred houses near the demarcation line in Donbas
15
Comment
Photo: facebook.com/evgeny.kaplin
Over the past four days, the occupiers damaged 104 civilian homes with shelling near the demarcation line in Donbas.
Four civilians received contusions and mine-explosive injuries,
reported
head of the "Prolisok" humanitarian mission
Evgeny Kaplin
on Facebook.
"Since the beginning of the escalation of hostilities, over the past four days, 104 civilian homes have been damaged near the demarcation line in the territory controlled by the government of Ukraine," Kaplin wrote.
READ ALSO:
The enemy riddled 20 settlements of Donetsk region with bullets: we have one more wounded
On the night of February 20 and Sunday, February 21, 22 houses of civilians were damaged during shelling from heavy weapons on the demarcation line: 14 in Novognativka, four in Pobyeda.
Also, one house was damaged in Slavne, Pivdenne, Malinove, Luhanske, etc. settlements.
In Donbas, the occupiers continue to violate the ceasefire by using weapons prohibited by the Minsk agreements.
The occupiers deploy their artillery systems
near residential buildings
and insidiously fire from populated areas. With such actions, the enemy is trying to force units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to return fire in order to later accuse Ukrainian defenders of shelling civilians.

translated_text:

Monday, February 21, 2022

History
What was advertised in Kyiv in the 1920s - a selection
10
Comment
Photo: irbis-nbuv.gov.ua
Gazeta.ua
collected advertisements that were published in the reference book of Kyiv for 1927.
At that time, the New Economic Policy was active in the USSR. It provided for the return of part of market relations. People were allowed to start small businesses and engage in private trade.
Until 1930, Kyiv was the center of the Kyiv District. Kharkiv was then the capital of Soviet Ukraine.
"During the short period of peaceful construction, Kyiv is being rebuilt extremely quickly and widely. It seems that all this happened so recently, but the people of Kyiv have already forgotten the broken bridges, destroyed and burned houses, frozen factories, the rich and valuable Kyiv communal economy brought to a state of complete decay. They have forgotten, because not even a trace of that terrible ruin remains," the book says.

491,000 people lived in the city and the population was growing. Kyiv was the economic and cultural center of the region.
Gazeta.ua collected photos from Kyiv in 1943. It was then the capital of Ukraine
under Nazi occupation
. The photo was taken at the "Dynamo" stadium named after Valery Lobanovskyi.

translated_title: Imitation of the Cold War, the journalist suggested, why does Putin have tension on the borders of Ukraine - 24 Kanal
translated_text:
An imitation of the Cold War, the journalist suggested, why does Putin have tension on the borders of Ukraine
February 21, 2022,
15:47
Read the news in Russian
School about tensions on the borders of Ukraine / Kremlin website
Vladimir Putin may neglect negotiations regarding the security situation around Ukraine in particular. Currently, the Kremlin's goal is to pressure the West with a possible war.
The politician and journalist told about it on the air of Channel 24
Andrii Shkil.
According to him, Putin is demonstrating the same thing that the Russian troops want to demonstrate on the borders of Ukraine.
Pay attention
The topic is not mentioned: Putin decided to hold a meeting of the Security Council
"What is this (tension on the borders of Ukraine - Channel 24) for? It's pressure, an imitation of the Cold War," Andriy Shkil said.
The journalist noted that during the Cold War between the USSR and the West, the latter increased armaments to put pressure on the economy of the Soviet Union. He offered one threat to another.
Putin "changed" it all and is trying to pressure the West to make concessions with the pressure of the war with Ukraine, which is a war in Europe.
Andrii Shkil
Politician, journalist
Russia is bluffing, - Shkil
Russia wants the West to remove all sanctions from it, to allow it to officially annex Crimea, to take away from Ukraine the right to determine its own fate regarding joining NATO, and also to take away the troops and weapons that ensure the security of the countries of the Alliance that border it. That is, to do everything that is impossible to do, said Andriy Shkil.
The USA, according to the journalist, plays the role of a strict negotiator and says: "If there is a war, you will regret starting it." At the same time, French President Emmanuel Macron agrees that Russia "has the right to make claims."
Note!
Against the background of the threat of an attack by Russia, French President Emmanuel
Macron said that he managed to reach an agreement
about the summit between Vladimir Putin and Joe Biden.
"But Macron's reaction is also dictated by the fact that they, together with the United States, understand that war is inevitable in Russia's plans. Russia must at least confirm this bluff with something," said Shkil.
Andriy Shkil on Russia's plans: watch the video
Probable offensive of Russia: the latest news
The Minister of Defense of Ukraine Oleksiy Reznikov revealed the probable plan of the Russian invasion. The enemy
may try to surround Ukraine with troops
- from Brest to Taganrog, on land, on 2 seas and in the temporarily occupied Crimea.
February 20
the Russian invaders shelled Luhansk.
The Armed Forces of Ukraine explained that the militants struck for the purpose of provocations.
According to mass media, near the borders of Ukraine
Russia concentrated approximately 75%
of its conventional armed forces, deployed 120 out of 160 battalion-tactical groups.

translated_text:
The topic is not mentioned: Putin has decided to hold a meeting of the Security Council today
February 21, 2022,
10:45 a.m
Read the news in Russian
Putin decided to hold a Security Council meeting on February 21 / RBC-Ukraine
Vladimir Putin decided to hold a meeting of the Security Council of Russia on February 21. The spokesman of the head of the Kremlin, Dmytro Peskov, said that this is not another meeting.
Source:
Interfax
At the same time, the topics of the meeting currently remain a secret. Peskov promised to reveal the details later.
It is important
The whole world laughed: Peskov declared that Russia had never attacked anyone in history
Journalists asked Putin's spokesman whether this Security Council meeting was an emergency.
This is irregular (meeting is channel 24). The president also has several international phone calls scheduled today,
- answered the representative of the Kremlin.
Note that Putin recently convened a meeting of the Security Council. During it, they also talked about the situation around Ukraine, with an emphasis on growing tensions. There was also an exchange of views on the topic of "security guarantees" for Russia.
Pay attention!
US President Joe Biden also spent February 20 at the White House
meeting of the National Security Council.
The main topic is the situation on the borders of Ukraine.
Previously, the American leader, referring to intelligence data,
made a loud statement
. He is convinced that Putin will dare to invade Ukraine again.
The politician says
which has every reason to believe so. At the same time, Biden emphasized, it is not too late to de-escalate and return to diplomatic negotiations.
What is known about the escalation in Donbas
The situation in Donbas
significantly intensified since February 17.
At that time, 60 shellings by Russian militants per day were recorded. Already on February 18, there were 66 shellings, on 19 ‚Äì 134. The past day was not calm either. The enemy attacked our positions 80 times.
In parallel with this, the occupiers fully deployed Russian propaganda. On February 18, Russian mercenaries announced the evacuation of the population of Donbass to Russia. They said that people are threatened by the Armed Forces of Ukraine, although in reality it is the militants who are shelling residential areas.
Vladimir Putin promised all "refugees" 10 thousand rubles each.
By the way, no one has received this money yet. At first, people were left to their own devices. They are
sat all night in cold buses
in the village of the Red Landing of the Nekliniv district. People were without food, water and a normal toilet.
Later, some people were placed in a gym, and others were placed in cramped tents of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations. Although they promised resorts and sanatoriums.

translated_title: The population of the temporarily occupied territories is like in a concentration camp, Feigin - Channel 24
translated_text:
The population of the temporarily occupied territories is like in a concentration camp, - Feigin
February 21, 2022,
18:18
Read the news in Russian
The population of the Russian-occupied territories of Donetsk and Luhansk regions is currently being evacuated to the aggressor country, where they are simply left to their own devices. In addition, active mobilization began there.
It is no secret that the Russian authorities are not interested in the opinion of the local population, so they are not asked about anything. A Russian human rights defender told about this on Channel 24
Mark Fagin
.
To the topic
The occupiers of Donbas said they were evacuating people to Russia
Like in a concentration camp
The population of the occupied territories of Donetsk and Luhansk regions is in a concentration camp,
- remarked the human rights defender.
Feigin added that Ukrainians living in the occupied territories are not asked whether they want to leave. Moreover, in the background
mobilization deployed there
the population does not "feel a burning desire to fight" at all.
They will be mobilized and thrown simply to the border, so that their former fellow citizens will open fire on them,
- noted the human rights defender.
Part of the provocation
According to Feigin, this is all part of the Russian provocation. He added that residents will continue to be driven "here and there" and "thrown into battle like cattle."
Read also
4,000 "evacuees" from the occupied Donbas are asking Russia for the promised money
Feigin talked about Russian provocations in the occupied territories: watch the video
The situation in the occupied territories of Ukraine: the latest
The occupiers in Donbas do not stop shelling not only the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, but also mindlessly attack the objects of civil infrastructure.
In general, the situation is worsening
, but our state does not yet plan to introduce martial law.
The decision of the leaders of the militants on the so-called "evacuation" is regarded as the illegal movement of Ukrainian citizens across the state border. Probably, this is happening against the will of the "evacuees" themselves. Such a statement
made the consul general
Taras Malyshevsky of Ukraine in Rostov-on-Don.
Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova reported that Ukraine
opened criminal proceedings
through the "evacuation" of Ukrainians to Russia. According to her, this is "deportation" and "catch of conscripts".
